Position: Remote Sensing Scientist and Geospatial Software Engineer, PrincipalType: Full-time – Employee or Consultant (depending on location)Location: Work from home/in US time zonesCompany SummaryPosition ResponsibilitiesTerra Global is seeking a Remote Sensing Scientist and Geospatial Software Engineer. This position is for someone who is energized by solving problems using location-based data and takes pride in developing solutions that will drive climate finance to communities and governments for sustainable landscape management. The position requires understanding both GIS/RS and driving the innovation to leverage local knowledge with global data sets. The position requires working closely with a technical team and working collaboratively with team members with diverse skill sets.The position will be responsible for:Executing the workflow of remote sensing analysis (data acquisition, re-projection, geometric correction, radiometric correction, classification, and map production)Collecting, generating and managing spatial data at project, regional and global scalesConducting spatial analyses and produce maps to meet reporting requirements, with a particular focus on the new consolidated REDD methodology and JNR.Runing and improving the existing Python code to manipulate large raster datasetsCreating new tools in Python. Executing land-use change modeling and GHG accounting at site-based and jurisdictional scalesReviewing technical aspects of AFOLU GHG projects and programs and provide guidance to project developers regarding project typology, eligible methodologies and mechanics of carbon monitoring, reporting and verificationVisiting project sites in developing countries, for data gathering and sharing, mapping and to collect ground-truthing dataContribute to creation and review of carbon feasibility studies, Project Documents and Monitoring and Implementation Reports including background research and creation of content.Essential Skills And QualificationsA minimum of seven (7) to ten (10) years of progressive, relevant GIS/RS experience in applications that involve forestry, agriculture and/or land-use change analysis in developing countries. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Forestry, Geography, Remote Sensing/Geospatial Science or related field, or equivalent experience is required.The candidate’s required skills are:Technical SkillsIn-depth understanding of ESRI ArcGIS platform, including ArcGIS Desktop/Pro, Server, Enterprise/Portal, and Image ServerKnowledge of open-source geospatial solutions like QGIS and Google Earth EngineKnowledge of acquisition, management, interpretation, and exploitation of remote sensing data including spaceborne, airborne, and UAV data and imagery, mosaics, and LiDARIn-depth technical knowledge and skills including geo-database design and spatial relationshipsTechnical knowledge and skills performing land use and land cover change maps using different sources of satellite imageries including multispectral imagery and radar dataGood understanding of Python, including GDAL package, MATLAB and JavaScriptFluency with the MS Office suite, including formatting in Word and advanced Excel skills.Other SkillsFluency in machine learning packagesFluency with public cloud services (AWS) and CI/CD toolsThorough understanding of (geo-)statistics and data extraction and analysisExperience with GHG market standards, guidelines and protocolsActively working to learn new skills in order to stay ahead of with changing technologies and industry trends and shares knowledge proactively with othersAble to apply business knowledge to develop and deliver innovative, beneficial improvementsExcellent collaboration skills in working together with others while working remoteDemonstrable ability to operate and effectively communicate while under pressure, as well as the ability to lead a diverse workload and work under time constraintsThis position requires occasional travel up to 20%Excellent oral and written communication skills, skilled in communicating technical topics to non-technical audiencesPossess either English or Spanish writing and speaking skills, English understanding is requiredExperience working in an international environment, specifically in developing countries.What We Offer“16 Years of Passion and Persistence for People and the Planet”: work for a successful, mission driven social enterprise that is an industry leader in facilitating financially, socially, and environmentally sustainable landscapes in developing countries and emerging economiesProfessional Growth: thrive on the opportunity to learn through training and development with dedicated professionals working from different countries around the worldCollaboration: join a great team atmosphere and a corporate culture based on mutual respect, partnerships, flat reporting structures and the opportunity to work from home.Compensation$68k - $90k
